docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 19 -- Eric A. Johnston, president of the Chamber of Commerce of the United States, delivered to President Roosevelt today a confidential verbal message from President Castillo of Argentina relating to the relations between this...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 19 -- Eric A. Johnston, president of the Chamber of Commerce of the United States, delivered to President Roosevelt today a confidential verbal message from President Castillo of Argentina relating to the relations between this country and Argentina, the only nation in the Western Hemisphere which has not broken off diplomatic relations with the Axis powers.
docs.abstract: delivers confidential verbal message from Argentine Pres Castillo to Roosevelt

headline.main: WORD FROM CASTILLO GIVEN TO ROOSEVELT; Johnston Brings a Confidential Message From Argentina

docs.snippet: The Museum of Modern Art, 11 West Fifty-third Street, has built up what it considers the most important collection of Latin-American art in the world. In an exhibition that opened with a preview yesterday, filling all of the galleries on the second...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Museum of Modern Art, 11 West Fifty-third Street, has built up what it considers the most important collection of Latin-American art in the world. In an exhibition that opened with a preview yesterday, filling all of the galleries on the second floor, 224 new acquisitions in this field were placed on view for the first time here.

headline.main: SHOWS MODERN ART OF LATIN AMERICA; Museum Places on View 224 New Acquisitions Selected by Lincoln Kirstein

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 30 -- Thirty-eight governments have been invited to be represented through small groups of technical experts at a United Nations conference on post-war problems of food and other essential agricultural products which will be...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 30 -- Thirty-eight governments have been invited to be represented through small groups of technical experts at a United Nations conference on post-war problems of food and other essential agricultural products which will be convoked at "some suitable place" in this country on April 27.

headline.main: 38 NATIONS CALLED TO PARLEY ON FOOD; Conference to Begin April 27 at 'Some Suitable Place' in United States

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 2 -- Nine governments, including those of Soviet Russia, the United Kingdom and China, have already accepted the invitation to the United Nations conference of technical experts on post-war food problems which will open in this...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 2 -- Nine governments, including those of Soviet Russia, the United Kingdom and China, have already accepted the invitation to the United Nations conference of technical experts on post-war food problems which will open in this country April 27, Secretary Hull said today.

byline.original: By BERTRAM D. HULENSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: IN last Sunday's article some stress was laid on the marked prominence of Latin-American art in the realm of exhibition activities just now. A comprehensive Mexican show opened late last month at the Philadelphia Museum. In the Brooklyn Museum...
docs.lead_paragraph: IN last Sunday's article some stress was laid on the marked prominence of Latin-American art in the realm of exhibition activities just now. A comprehensive Mexican show opened late last month at the Philadelphia Museum. In the Brooklyn Museum watercolor biennial, due next Friday, 81 of the 219 examples, we are informed, will be by Argentinean, Brazilian, Cuban and Mexican artists.

headline.main: NEIGHBORS; Work of Republics To the South

docs.snippet: PANAMA, April 3 -- The extent of Latin America's contribution to the war effort in the way of raw materials is a matter of conjecture since statistics are not available, but they supplement our domestic supply sufficiently to make us independent of...
docs.lead_paragraph: PANAMA, April 3 -- The extent of Latin America's contribution to the war effort in the way of raw materials is a matter of conjecture since statistics are not available, but they supplement our domestic supply sufficiently to make us independent of other sources.

headline.main: LATIN AMERICA SENDS US AID; Vital Products Like Oil, Quinine, Copper Help to Keep the War Machine Going

byline.original: By C.H. CALHOUNSpecial Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: SPAIN adds to the gallery of philately a sixteenth-century monk, San Juan de la Cruz, who played a major role in the progress of Catholicism in his time. Three stamps, 20-centimos violet, 40c orange and 75c blue, carry his likeness.
